014package org.microbean.producer;
015
016import java.util.SequencedSet;
017
018import org.microbean.bean.Aggregate;
019import org.microbean.bean.Assignment;
020import org.microbean.bean.AttributedElement;
021import org.microbean.bean.Request;
022
023/**
024 * An interface whose implementations {@linkplain #produce(Request) produce} possibly uninitialized contextual
025 * instances.
026 *
027 * <p>{@link Producer}s are used to implement {@link org.microbean.bean.Factory} instances' {@link
028 * org.microbean.bean.Factory#create(Request) create(Request)} and {@link org.microbean.bean.Factory#destroy(Object,
029 * Request) destroy(Object, Request)} methods. Values returned from the {@link #produce(Request)} method are often
030 * supplied to {@link Initializer}s.</p>
031 *
032 * @param <I> the type of contextual instance
033 *
034 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
035 *
036 * @see #produce(Request)
037 *
038 * @see org.microbean.bean.Factory#create(Request)
039 */
040// Subordinate to Factory<I> (really to Initializer<I>)
041// Akin to CDI's Producer.
042// Handles instance production and disposal, *including intercepted production*.
043//
044// Does NOT handle initialization; see for example
045// https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Aweld%2Fcore+%22.produce%28%29%22+language%3AJava&type=code. Obviously it may
046// acquire dependencies and supply them during production, but the point is it doesn't do field injection or initializer
047// method invocation.
048//
049// Does NOT handle post-initialization.
050// Does NOT handle business method interception.
051// Does NOT handle pre-disposal.
052// See also: InterceptingProducer
053@FunctionalInterface
054public interface Producer<I> extends Aggregate {
055
056  /**
057   * A convenience method that assigns a contextual reference to each of this {@link Aggregate}'s {@link
058   * org.microbean.bean.AttributedElement} instances and returns the resulting {@link SequencedSet} of {@link
059   * Assignment}s.
060   *
061   * <p>Typically there is no need to override this method.</p>
062   *
063   * @param r a {@link Request} that retrieves a contextual reference suitable for an {@link
064   * org.microbean.bean.AttributedType}; must not be {@code null}
065   *
066   * @return an immutable {@link SequencedSet} of {@link Assignment} instances; never {@code null}
067   *
068   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code r} is {@code null}
069   *
070   * @see #assign(java.util.function.Function)
071   */
072  public default SequencedSet<? extends Assignment<?>> assign(final Request<?> r) {
073    return this.assign(r::reference);
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Returns an immutable {@link SequencedSet} of {@link AttributedElement} instances <strong>required for instance
078   * creation only</strong>.
079   *
080   * <p>The returned {@link SequencedSet} may be, and often is, empty.</p>
081   *
082   * <p>Overriding this method is normal and expected.</p>
083   *
084   * <p>Any overrides of this method must return determinate values.</p>
085   *
086   * @return an immutable {@link SequencedSet} of {@link AttributedElement} instances; never {@code null}
087   *
088   * @see Aggregate#dependencies()
089   *
090   * @see #assign(java.util.function.Function)
091   *
092   * @see #produce(SequencedSet)
093   *
094   * @see AttributedElement
095   */
096  @Override // Aggregate
097  public default SequencedSet<AttributedElement> dependencies() {
098    return Aggregate.super.dependencies();
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Disposes of the supplied contextual instance.
103   *
104   * <p>The default implementation of this method checks to see if {@code i} is an instance of {@link AutoCloseable},
105   * and, if so, calls {@link AutoCloseable#close() close()} on it, throwing any resulting exception as a {@link
106   * DisposalException}.</p>
107   *
108   * @param i a contextual instance {@linkplain #produce(Request) produced} by this {@link Producer}; may be {@code
109   * null}
110   *
111   * @param r the {@link Request} that was {@linkplain #produce(Request) present at production time}; must not be {@code
112   * null}
113   *
114   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code r} is {@code null}
115   *
116   * @exception DisposalException if {@code i} is an {@link AutoCloseable} instance, and if its {@link
117   * AutoCloseable#close() close()} method throws a checked exception
118   */
119  public default void dispose(final I i, final Request<I> r) {
120    if (i instanceof AutoCloseable ac) {
121      try {
122        ac.close();
123      } catch (final RuntimeException | Error e) {
124        throw e;
125      } catch (final InterruptedException e) {
126        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
127        throw new DisposalException(e.getMessage(), e);
128      } catch (final Exception e) {
129        throw new DisposalException(e.getMessage(), e);
130      }
131    }
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Produces a new contextual instance and returns it by calling the {@link #produce(SequencedSet)} method with the
136   * return value of an invocation of the {@link #assign(Function)} method with a reference to the supplied {@link
137   * Request}'s {@link Request#reference(AttributedType)} method.
138   *
139   * @param r a {@link Request}; must not be {@code null}
140   *
141   * @return a new contextual instance, or {@code null}
142   *
143   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code r} is {@code null}
144   *
145   * @see #produce(SequencedSet)
146   *
147   * @see #assign(Request)
148   */
149  public default I produce(final Request<?> r) {
150    return this.produce(this.assign(r));
151  }
152
153  /**
154   * Produces a new contextual instance and returns it, possibly (often) making use of the supplied, dependent,
155   * contextual references.
156   *
157   * <p>Implementations of this method must not call {@link #produce(Request)} or an infinite loop may result.</p>
158   *
159   * @param assignments a {@link SequencedSet} of {@link Assignment}s this {@link Producer} needs <strong>only to create
160   * the contextual instance</strong>; must not be {@code null}
161   *
162   * @return a new contextual instance, or {@code null}
163   *
164   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code dependentContextualReferences} is {@code null}
165   */
166  public I produce(final SequencedSet<? extends Assignment<?>> assignments);
167
168}
